summary: The document is a historical record associated with the JFK assassination, specifically a form from the HPSCI (House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence) bearing the record number 135-10001-10237. It details a telephone conversation with an individual named Sturgis on April 29, 1975, and is categorized under the file 'STURGIS, FRANK'. Classified as 'U' (Unclassified) without any restrictions, the document was last examined on September 2, 1994. It contains handwritten annotations that, while mostly illegible, appear to mention various names and potentially locations or incidents connected to the assassination.
key_findings: Document pertains to the investigation of the JFK assassination.
References a telephone conversation with Sturgis dated April 29, 1975.
Included in the file titled 'STURGIS, FRANK'.
The document is unclassified and fully accessible.
Contains handwritten notes that are largely illegible.
